str2: From the base of sozo and that of phren; safe in mind, i.e. Self-controlled.
From the same as hagios; properly, clean, i.e. innocent, modest, perfect.
A keeper-at-home, a housekeeper. From oikos and ouros; a stayer at home, i.e. Domestically inclined.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Plural
str2: From hupo and tasso; to subordinate; reflexively, to obey.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From blasphemos; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously.
